## Summary
Create comprehensive onboarding documentation for new team members, including getting started guide, development environment setup, codebase walkthrough, key concepts, first-week tasks, and team processes. Goal is to reduce onboarding time from 2 weeks to 3-5 days.

## Context
Effective onboarding documentation is critical for:
- Faster new team member productivity
- Consistent knowledge transfer
- Reduced dependency on senior team members
- Better team scaling
- Preservation of institutional knowledge

## Goals
- **Primary:** Complete onboarding guide reducing ramp-up time by 50%
- **Secondary:** Interactive exercises and hands-on labs
- **Stretch:** Video tutorials and screencasts

## Tasks

### Getting Started Guide

- [ ] **Welcome & Project Overview**
  - Project mission and goals
  - Universal multilingual search engine vision
  - Key features and differentiators
  - Success metrics and milestones
  - Team structure and roles

- [ ] **Development Environment Setup**
  ```markdown
  # Development Environment Setup
  
  ## Prerequisites
  - Linux/macOS/WSL2 (Windows)
  - Docker & Docker Compose
  - Git
  - C++ compiler (GCC 11+ or Clang 14+)
  - Python 3.9+
  - Node.js 18+
  
  ## Clone Repository
  ```bash
  git clone https://github.com/your-org/search-engine-core.git
  cd search-engine-core
  ```
  
  ## Install Dependencies
  ```bash
  # C++ dependencies (vcpkg)
  ./scripts/install-deps.sh
  
  # Python dependencies
  pip install -r requirements.txt
  
  # Node.js dependencies (if applicable)
  npm install
  ```
  
  ## Start Services
  ```bash
  # Start all services with Docker Compose
  docker compose up -d
  
  # Verify services running
  docker ps
  
  # Check logs
  docker logs core --tail 50
  ```
  
  ## Verify Setup
  ```bash
  # Test search API
  curl "http://localhost:3000/api/v2/search?q=test"
  
  # Test health endpoint
  curl "http://localhost:3000/api/v2/health"
  
  # Open frontend
  open http://localhost:3000
  ```
  
  ## Common Issues
  - **Port conflicts:** Change ports in docker-compose.yml
  - **Permission denied:** Run with sudo or add user to docker group
  - **Build errors:** Check compiler version and dependencies
  ```

- [ ] **Project Structure Walkthrough**
  ```markdown
  # Codebase Structure
  
  ## High-Level Overview
  search-engine-core/
  â”œâ”€â”€ src/                    # C++ source code
  â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ controllers/        # API endpoint handlers
  â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ storage/            # Database & data access layer
  â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ services/           # Business logic services
  â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.cpp            # Application entry point
  â”œâ”€â”€ include/                # C++ headers
  â”œâ”€â”€ python/                 # Python ML/NLP components
  â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ embeddings/         # Embedding training & inference
  â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ intent/             # Intent classification
  â”‚   â””â”€â”€ quality/            # Spam/quality detection
  â”œâ”€â”€ public/                 # Static files (CSS, JS, images)
  â”œâ”€â”€ templates/              # HTML templates (Inja)
  â”œâ”€â”€ locales/                # Internationalization (i18n)
  â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                   # Documentation
  â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/                # Utility scripts
  â””â”€â”€ docker-compose.yml      # Service orchestration
  
  ## Key Components
  - **Controllers:** Handle HTTP requests, validation, responses
  - **Storage:** MongoDB/Redis data access, abstracts DB operations
  - **Services:** Embedding service, intent classifier, spam detector
  - **Routing:** Dynamic route registration via macros
  - **Feature Store:** Centralized storage for ranking signals
  ```

- [ ] **Key Concepts & Terminology**
  - Universal multilingual support (100+ languages)
  - BM25 vs. Embedding-based retrieval
  - HostRank (host-level PageRank)
  - FinalScore formula and feature weights
  - Stopword detection (IDF-based, automatic)
  - Query pipeline stages
  - Atomic tasks methodology

### First Week Tasks & Milestones

- [ ] **Day 1: Environment & Exploration**
  - [ ] Complete development environment setup
  - [ ] Run smoke tests and verify all services work
  - [ ] Read architecture overview documentation
  - [ ] Explore codebase structure
  - [ ] Meet the team (introductions)
  
  **Deliverable:** Working development environment

- [ ] **Day 2-3: Code Reading & Understanding**
  - [ ] Read SearchController and understand search API flow
  - [ ] Trace a query from API â†’ Retrieval â†’ Ranking â†’ Response
  - [ ] Read feature glossary (all 9 ranking features)
  - [ ] Understand FinalScore formula and feature weights
  - [ ] Review MongoDB and Redis data models
  
  **Deliverable:** Document your understanding (1-page summary)

- [ ] **Day 4: First Code Contribution**
  - [ ] Fix a "good first issue" (labeled in GitHub)
  - [ ] Add a unit test for existing functionality
  - [ ] Submit pull request
  - [ ] Participate in code review
  
  **Deliverable:** Merged PR

- [ ] **Day 5: Deep Dive & Knowledge Check**
  - [ ] Present codebase walkthrough to team (15 min)
  - [ ] Explain FinalScore formula and feature interactions
  - [ ] Debug a search query using debug mode
  - [ ] Answer knowledge check questions
  
  **Deliverable:** Successful presentation and Q&A

### Hands-On Exercises

- [ ] **Exercise 1: Run a Debug Query**
  ```bash
  # Run search with debug mode
  curl "http://localhost:3000/api/v2/search?q=machine+learning&debug=1" | jq
  
  # Questions:
  # 1. What is the detected language and script?
  # 2. What are the top 3 feature scores for result #1?
  # 3. What is the BM25 score vs. EmbSim score?
  # 4. Is stopword filtering applied? Why or why not?
  ```

- [ ] **Exercise 2: Add a New Test Case**
  ```cpp
  // Add a test case to test/search_test.cpp
  TEST(SearchTest, MultilingualQuery) {
      // Test Persian query
      auto results = search("Ø¢Ù…ÙˆØ²Ø´ Ø¨Ø±Ù†Ø§Ù…Ù‡â€ŒÙ†ÙˆÛŒØ³ÛŒ");
      ASSERT_GT(results.size(), 0);
      ASSERT_EQ(results[0].language, "fa");
  }
  ```

- [ ] **Exercise 3: Trace a Feature Extraction**
  - Set breakpoint in `FeatureGatherer::gatherFeatures()`
  - Step through BM25, EmbSim, HostRank extraction
  - Observe final score calculation
  - Document the flow

- [ ] **Exercise 4: Modify Feature Weights**
  ```cpp
  // In RankingFusion.cpp, change a weight
  const double BM25_WEIGHT = 0.60;  // Was 0.55
  
  // Rebuild and test
  cd build && make -j4
  docker cp build/server core:/app/server
  docker restart core
  
  # Compare results before and after
  # Document observed changes
  ```

### Team Processes & Workflows

- [ ] **Git Workflow**
  - Branching strategy (feature branches, main)
  - Commit message conventions
  - Pull request process
  - Code review expectations
  - CI/CD pipeline

- [ ] **Development Workflow**
  - Local development cycle (edit â†’ build â†’ test)
  - Docker workflow (build â†’ deploy â†’ verify)
  - Debug techniques (logs, breakpoints, debug mode)
  - Performance profiling

- [ ] **Documentation Standards**
  - Code comments (when and how)
  - Atomic task format
  - Runbook structure
  - API documentation updates

- [ ] **Communication Channels**
  - Daily standups (time, format)
  - Slack/Discord channels
  - Issue tracking (GitHub Issues)
  - Knowledge sharing (weekly tech talks)

### Knowledge Check Quiz

- [ ] **Architecture Questions**
  1. What is the difference between BM25 and embedding-based retrieval?
  2. How does HostRank differ from traditional PageRank?
  3. What are the 9 features in the FinalScore formula?
  4. Explain the query pipeline stages from API to response.
  5. How does universal language support work without manual configuration?

- [ ] **Code Questions**
  1. Where is the search API endpoint handler located?
  2. How do controllers register routes dynamically?
  3. What is the role of the MongoDBInstance singleton?
  4. How are feature values stored and retrieved?
  5. What is the difference between stream builder and basic builder in MongoDB?

- [ ] **Operational Questions**
  1. How do you rebuild the search index?
  2. What is the procedure for rolling back a model?
  3. How do you debug a query that returns no results?
  4. What are the P0 incident response steps?
  5. Where are the runbooks located?

## Technical Approach

### Onboarding Checklist
```markdown
# New Team Member Onboarding Checklist

## Week 1: Setup & Orientation
- [ ] Development environment setup complete
- [ ] All services running locally
- [ ] Repository access granted
- [ ] Documentation read (architecture, API, features)
- [ ] Team introductions complete
- [ ] First PR merged

## Week 2: Deep Dive
- [ ] Understand FinalScore formula
- [ ] Trace query pipeline end-to-end
- [ ] Complete all hands-on exercises
- [ ] Participate in code review
- [ ] Present knowledge check

## Week 3: First Feature
- [ ] Pick an atomic task
- [ ] Implement feature with tests
- [ ] Submit PR and address feedback
- [ ] Deploy to staging
- [ ] Document learnings

## Week 4: Independence
- [ ] Work on multiple tasks independently
- [ ] Participate in on-call rotation (shadowing)
- [ ] Contribute to team discussions
- [ ] Suggest improvements
```

## Acceptance Criteria

### Documentation Completeness
- [ ] Getting started guide with environment setup
- [ ] Project structure walkthrough
- [ ] Key concepts and terminology explained
- [ ] First-week tasks with daily milestones
- [ ] 5+ hands-on exercises with solutions
- [ ] Team processes and workflows documented
- [ ] Knowledge check quiz with answers

### Usability
- [ ] New team member can set up environment in <2 hours
- [ ] All commands are copy-pasteable and tested
- [ ] Exercises have clear objectives and success criteria
- [ ] Documentation references other docs (architecture, API, features)
- [ ] Common issues and troubleshooting included

### Effectiveness
- [ ] Onboarding time reduced from 2 weeks to 3-5 days
- [ ] New team members complete first PR by day 4
- [ ] Knowledge check pass rate >80%
- [ ] Positive feedback from new hires (NPS >8)
- [ ] Buddy/mentor reports reduced questions

## Testing & Validation

### Onboarding Pilot
- [ ] Have new team member follow guide
- [ ] Observe and note friction points
- [ ] Measure actual time for each task
- [ ] Collect feedback and suggestions
- [ ] Update documentation based on learnings

### Continuous Improvement
```yaml
Review Cycle:
  - After each new hire: Collect feedback
  - Quarterly: Update for system changes
  - Annually: Comprehensive review
  
Feedback Channels:
  - Exit interview (after week 1)
  - Anonymous survey (after week 4)
  - Buddy/mentor feedback
  - Documentation issue tracker
```

- Week 1: Setup, understand architecture, first PR
- Week 2: Deep dive, complete exercises
- Week 3: First feature implementation
- Week 4: Independence and on-call shadowing

Let's get started! ðŸš€

## Notes

### Best Practices
1. **Hands-On First:** Learn by doing, not just reading
2. **Incremental:** Build confidence gradually
3. **Buddy System:** Pair new hires with experienced team members
4. **Feedback Loop:** Continuously improve based on feedback
5. **Celebrate Wins:** Recognize achievements (first PR, knowledge check)

### Common Pitfalls
- âŒ Too much reading, not enough doing
- âŒ Overwhelming with information
- âŒ No clear milestones or success criteria
- âŒ Outdated documentation
- âŒ No feedback mechanism

### Tools & Resources
- [First Day of Dev](https://firstdayofdev.com/)
- [The Pragmatic Engineer - Onboarding](https://blog.pragmaticengineer.com/onboarding-engineers/)
- [GitLab Handbook](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/)

## Success Metrics
- Onboarding time reduced from 2 weeks to 3-5 days
- First PR merged by day 4 (100% of new hires)
- Knowledge check pass rate >80%
- New hire satisfaction >8 NPS
- Reduced questions to senior team members by 60%
